ingredients: Marinade for Mushrooms:2 Tbsp olive oil
A small handful of pine nuts
instructions: Wash and clean the lettuce and put in the fridge.
Wash and pat dry the mushrooms, take the stems and reserve for a stock.
Marinate the mushrooms with olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt and pepper.
Put herbs like rosemary and thyme.
Grill for a few minutes.
For the Stuffing:
In a bowl add chopped apricots, goat cheese, parmesan cheese, chopped chives, salt, pepper, panko Japanese breadcrumbs, cream, chopped parsley and pine nuts and give it a nice mix and set aside.
For the Filling:
In a mixer, add apricots, mustard, parmesan cheese, cream, salt, smashed garlic, olive oil, red wine vinegar and give it a nice blend until nice and creamy. Keep refrigerated.
For the Tomato Salad:
In a blender make a rough mix of the pine nuts, rocket, olive oil and salt.
Slice the tomatoes into chunky wedges.
Pour the pine nut mix over the tomatoes and let it rest.
Trim the oyster mushrooms and add them to the marinating tomatoes.
Take a spoon full of the goat cheese filling and put it on top of the grilled Portobello mushrooms.
Put the mushroom into a pre heated oven for 3-4 minutes at 180 C.
Spread the dressing over each lettuce leaf with a brush.
Serve the stuffed mushroom with the tomato salad, the romaine leaves and a glass of olives.

name: Ragi Wheat Bread
instructions: Take a bowl and put the above ingredients in it.
Mix all the ingredients together till it gets consistency.
Spread the mixture in a baking dish and put in oven for 40 minutes at 180 degrees.
Take it out from the oven and slice evenly.

name: Walnut Oil Sauteed Green Beans
ingredients: 1 medium sized red bell pepper, roasted
instructions: Peel the skin off of the roasted bell pepper and chop it into thin strips.
Heat the walnut oil and the olive oil in a pan and fry chopped garlic in it.
Then add the chopped bell pepper, pine nuts, cracked black pepper and stir well.
Add the blanched green beans and toss well.
Season with salt and Serve hot

name: Charred Broccoli and Grilled Yellow Squash Salad
ingredients: 1/2 medium yellow squash, cut into thick batons
1 Tbsp of extra virgin olive oil
instructions: Marinate the broccoli and yellow squash with olive oil, cracked black pepper and salt.
Put the marinated vegetables on to the grill.
Baste the vegetables on the grill with olive oil and keep turning them.
Take them off the grill once they get mildly charred.
To make the dressing for the salad, blend together garlic cloves, thyme leaves, extra virgin olive oil, chili flakes, cumin powder and sherry vinegar.
Add the dressing to the charred vegetables and mix well.
Garnish with chives and serve hot.

name: Stone Fruit Crumble
ingredients: 1/2 cup of pitted dates, roughly chopped
instructions: In a bowl mix all the ingredients for the crumble thoroughly.
Cut the plums and peaches into cubes and put in a bowl.
In a hot pan melt brown sugar with red wine.
To this add a cinnamon stick and star anise.
Add the mixed fruits, berries and chopped dates into the hot pan and let it cook.
Cover the pan and let the fruits cook for a few minutes till soft but not mushy.
Put the stewed fruits in a baking dish and chill in the refrigerator for 5-7 minutes.
Remove and sprinkle the crumble over the fruits.
Bake in the oven at 180 degrees for 10-15 minutes.
Garnish with mint leaves and serve hot or cold.

name: Himalyan Red Rice and Provencal Vegetable Ragu
ingredients: A big pinch of smoked paprika
A few leaves of fresh thyme
A few sprigs of fresh sage
A few leaves of fresh oregano
A few sprigs of fresh parsley
1 cup of cooked red rice, boiled & drained
instructions: Cut the onion, zucchini, yellow squash, eggplant, red, yellow and green bell peppers into large squares about 2-1/2 cm.
In a hot pan add the olive oil, onions, garlic, zucchini, yellow squash, bell peppers and eggplant.
Saute for 2-3 minutes till the vegetables are translucent.
Add red chilli flakes and smoked paprika and mix well.
Season the vegetables with salt and add a few sprigs of thyme, sage and oregano.
Mix in the tomato puree, chopped tomatoes and a few sprigs of parsley.
Pour in the white wine, add the cooked red rice and toss well.
Season with cracked black pepper, salt and hot sauce.
Then cover with aluminum foil and cook in the oven for 5 minutes at 180 degrees C.
Garnish with chopped parsley and extra virgin olive oil.

name: Bell Peppers Stuffed with Barley
ingredients: A few basil leaves for garnishing
instructions: Cut the tops of the bell peppers and scoop out the insides in order to create a nice hollow pocket.
Season the peppers with salt, pepper and lightly brush the outsides and insides with olive oil.
Roast bell peppers in a moderately hot oven for 7-8 minutes at 190 degrees Celsius, so that they are 1/4th cooked and still firm.
In a pan heat 1 tbsp of olive oil and sweat the onions, leeks and celery for 1 to 2 minutes until they start releasing their flavour.
Add the chickpeas, 2 cups of cooked barley, cherry tomatoes and give it a nice toss.
Season with salt and pepper and add the cumin powder, Guilin chilli paste, basil leaves, chopped parsley and juice of half a lemon.
Sauté all the ingredients together for a minute.
Add the frozen green peas and lemon juice and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Then stuff the bell peppers with the cooked filling.
Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil.
Bake in the oven for 10 minutes at 180 degrees C.
Garnish with basil leaves And serve hot.

name: Stuffed Eggplant
ingredients: 1 medium sized eggplant, cut into half, lengthwise
1-2 Tbsp of extra virgin olive oil, for sauteing
1 cup of mixed red, yellow & green bell peppers, finely chopped
instructions: Score the inside of the eggplant and sprinkle with salt, pepper and chopped thyme.
Drizzle the olive oil over and bake it for 15 minutes at 180 degrees C, until it is soft and cooked.
Let it rest till its cool enough to handle.
Heat the extra virgin olive oil in a pan and sauté the zucchini with the red, yellow and green bell peppers.
Mix in the chickpeas, diced tomatoes
Season with salt, zataar spice, sumack powder, red chilli powder and stir well for 2-3 minutes.
Add the mint leaves, fresh coriander and parsley. Mix well.
Add the cooked basmati rice to the vegetables and mix it all together.
Using a spoon, lightly scoop out most of the flesh from the eggplant, and add it to the rice and vegetable mixture.
Mix the filling well and spoon it back into the eggplant.
Place the eggplants on a baking tray.
Crumble feta cheese over the eggplant, sprinkle with cracked black pepper and again bake in the oven for 8-10 minutes at 190 degrees C.
Serve hot.

name: Cauliflower Bake
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper, de-seeded and diced
1 yellow bell pepper, de-seeded and diced
1 green bell pepper, de-seeded and diced
250 gm cheddar cheese (you can normal processed cheese also), grated
instructions: Heat the milk in a saucepan.
Remove the white core of 1 onion. Add onion to the milk. Add a sprig of fresh rosemary and some pepper. (Don't have rosemary? Use thyme or basil)
Cut the cauliflower into florets and add to the milk. Once the milk has boiled, remove the florets and keep aside.
Cover and let the milk continue simmering till it reduces to half the quantity.
Then remove the onion and add 100 gms of the cheese into the milk. Stir well and let it reduce for 3-4 minutes.
Heat the olive oil in a pan and saute the sliced onion, bell peppers and garlic together for a minute.
Sprinkle some fresh oregano and cracked black pepper and give it a nice toss. Cook for another 30 seconds and keep aside.
In a baking dish, arrange the cauliflower florets and the sauteed vegetables at the base.
Sprinkle 50 gm of cheese over the veggies and pour evenly in the cheese-milk reduction.
Sprinkle another 100 gm of cheese on top and some black pepper.
Bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes at 180 degrees C or till it's golden brown.
Serve hot.

name: Balsamic Onion Omelette
ingredients: Cheese, pecorino or any other hard
instructions: Fry the onions until soft and then toss with balsamic vinegar and salt, keep aside.
Whip three eggs with a little water and salt and then in the olive oil make the omelette.
Finish off by arranging the onions and cheese then folding the omelette into a half-moon.
Serve.

name: Sunday Chicken Roast
ingredients: One full corn fed chicken, that's around 1.5 kg.
Pinch of a mix of dried herbs
A brush of butter on top (optional)
Stock your fridge with home made chicken stock.
Chicken stock can be made from chicken wings, carrot, onion, bay leaf, peppercorns and salt.
Grind your fresh herbs to release their flavour.
Don't salt your chicken way in advance, it will rob all the moisture away from it.
instructions: Take the chicken with skin on, and remove the unmentionables.
Take the garlic pods with the skin on, and smash them with a knife. Stuff the cavity of the chicken with the lemon and the garlic.
You can truss the chicken, many prefer to sew the chicken up.
Take a mortar and pestle, pour the olive oil in it, and add the rosemary and thyme leaves. Crush them into the oil.
Lightly massage the chicken with the flavoured olive oil.
Sprinkle a bit of the mixed dried herbs too. And some minced garlic.
Then add sea salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Now pour some chicken stock into the roasting pan (Get recipe: Fresh Chicken Stock)
Add roughly chopped celery, carrots and mini potatoes.
Then put the chicken in, it should fit snugly in the pan.
For kids, brush a swipe of butter on top. Put the pan the oven for 90 minutes at 190 degrees.
Turn the chicken over once or twice in the middle.
Let the chicken rest for ten minutes before you carve it. Spoon the gravy on top.

name: Roasted Duck
ingredients: 300 gms chestnuts, boiled and peeled, immerse in chicken stock
A bouquet of fresh herbs: thyme, rosemary, oregano, sage, parsley.
'Garam masala' spice (to be roasted in over for 5 mins)
instructions: Take some Brussels sprouts and add salt to one and a half litres of water.
Cross the ends of the Brussels sprouts and then boil in water until slightly crunchy.
Take the 1.8 kg duck with wings tucked at the back remove some of the fat.
Grind in the spices in a spice grinder and mix with equal quantity of sweet paprika and sea salt.
Massage the duck with the spice mix and a little olive oil inside and out.
Cut celery, onions, carrots, 1 leek into large pieces.
Mix with a little olive oil and place on the bottom of a roasting pan.
Place the duck on top and place into pre-heated oven at 180 C.
Roast for half an hour.
Remove the duck and place on a rack above the roasting pan with the vegetables.
Add tomato paste to the vegetables and mix well.
Continue to roast for another half an hour, stirring the vegetables frequently.
Remove the vegetable pan from the oven and de-glaze with half a bottle of red wine.
Scrape all that into a stock pot and set aside.
Continue to roast the duck for another half an hour or until, when pressing under the wing, the meat does not spring back and feels dull
Remove the duck from the oven and cool.
Cut duck down the middle lengthwise.
Remove all the bones and set the duck halves aside
Chop the bones into large pieces and add to the stockpot with the vegetables.
Add  bay leaves, pepper corns and fresh herbs: thyme, rosemary, oregano, sage, parsley.
Top with chicken broth till the duck bones and vegetables are swimming in the liquid and simmer for a good 6 hours, half covering the pot.
Strain the liquid and let it cool for an hour.
Skin off all the fat that has floated to the top with a ladle and reduce the stock to about 400ml, or until it has become quite thick.
Strain again through a very fine sieve and add the cherries.
Finish with a knob of butter stirred in.
To Serve:
Place the 2 half ducks in a roasting tray, add a cup of chicken broth and place in pre-heated oven for about 20 minutes
The duck should be crispy skinned by now
If it needs more time to crisp, drain out the chicken broth and continue baking
Place the hot chestnut puree in the middle of the plate.
Slice the crisped duck halves into 6 pieces; add on top of the puree and top with the sauce
Add the Brussels sprouts and enjoy.

name: Rice and Beans Pilaf
ingredients: For the plantain and lotus stem chips:
instructions: Boil the kidney beans in water with an onion and carrot.

In a little olive oil saute onions along with the diced bell peppers with the green peppercorn, spring onions, 1 chopped tomato, Tabasco, Worcestershire sauce, tomato ketchup, add red and yellow bell peppers and thyme leaves.
Season with salt and pepper.
Saute for a few minutes and set aside.
For the rice:
Wash and soak the rice.
Add the cooked kidney beans along with its cooking liquid and the coconut milk.
Season with thyme, salt and pepper.
Add a bunch of chopped coriander. (The level of the liquid should be above an inch over the rice)
Bring to a simmer and cook for 20-25 minutes covered.
For the plantain chips:
Spice dust for the chips: Make a mixture of onion powder, salt, cumin powder and red chilly powder.
Slice the lotus root very thin.
Peel the plantain and slice thinly.
Season with the spice dust and deep fry into crispy chips.
Sprinkle some more spice dust over the chips.

name: Steamed Asparagus with Potato and Leek Sauce
instructions: Cut the zucchini and yellow squash into thin batons.
Top and tail the green beans.
Cut the bottoms of the asparagus as they are woody.
For the vegetables:
Place a steamer tray into a pot of simmering water.
Add a sprig of rosemary and thyme into the water.
Place the yellow squash, zucchini, green beans and asparagus in the steamer.
Remove from boiling water and shock in iced water to retain colour.
For the Sauce:
Cut the leeks and potatoes into small cubes.
In a sauce pan add extra virgin olive oil, butter, add the leeks, the potatoes and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
Chop one clove of garlic and add to the sauteing vegetables.
Add the chopped roasted red bell pepper to the sauteing vegetables.
Add a few leaves of thyme and lightly saute the vegetables.
Blend the vegetables to a smooth sauce.
Slice a zucchini into circles and make a ring using a cutter.
Make a bunch of the steamed veggies and put it inside the zucchini ring.
To plate- Put the veggie ring in a pool of the sauce.
Garnish with chilli flavoured oil, balsamic oil, olive oil and chives.

name: Grilled Zucchini with Cottage Cheese
ingredients: 1/2 cup each black and green olives
instructions: Grill thin slices of the zucchinil.
In a mixer add green and black olives, a handful of parsley, basil leaves, salt and jalapeno chilies and olive oil mix into a nice paste.
Cut the cottage cheese into squares and sprinkle with some cracked black pepper.
Marinate the cottage cheese squares with the paste.
Wrap the cottage cheese with the grilled strips of zucchini.
And serve with a little lemon zest and citrus olive extract.

name: Herb Infused Veggies in a Bag
instructions: Soak the shiitake mushrooms in warm water for 10 minutes to soften.
Squeeze out the excess liquid.
Pat dry and cut into quarters.
Chop garlic chives, basil leaves, thyme leaves, tarragon and sage to infuse in olive oil.
Add the sliced garlic season with salt and pepper and red wine vinegar.
Cut the new potatoes into quarters and put in a bowl with the shitake mushroom and button mushroom and also halved cherry tomatoes.
Pour in the infused herb oil and drizzle with truffle oil.
Take parchment paper and cut into 4 squares about 8 to 10" in size.
Divide the mixture into 4 portions.
Spoon the mixture in the centre of each paper.
Bring the ends of the parchment paper together and tie with butcher's string.
Place the bags on a baking tray and cook for 12 to 15 minutes at 180 C.
Open only when ready to eat and garnish with basil leaves and olive oil.

name: Mushroom Bread with a Mushroom Ragout
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan to sauté the chopped onions, leeks and celery.
Add a teaspoon of grated garlic to the sautéing vegetables.
Add the button mushrooms and wild mushrooms to the pan.
Season with salt, cracked black pepper and rosemary.
Add the white wine to the mushrooms and give it a good toss.
Add 1 tablespoon of cream to the mushrooms so that it does not dry out.
Cut the bread into strips.
Grill or toast the bread.
Apply the mushroom mixture over the mushroom bread with some truffle oil.
Sprinkle with the grated parmesan cheese.
Grill in the oven for 5-7 minutes at 180 C.
Garnish with thyme leaves, truffle oil and grated parmesan cheese.
Serve hot.

name: Barley and Red Rice Salad
ingredients: ½ cup red kidney beans cooked
instructions: Chop all ingredients and put in a bowl.
In another bowl add orange juice, lime juice, a little salt, pepper and olive oil.
Mix it around.
Add some thyme and pour over the salad.
Garnish with a leaf of basil.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Peach and Bell Pepper Chutney
instructions: In a big pan, add a little olive oil and fry a clove, fennel seeds, black peppercorns, cinnamon stick, cumin powder, star anise, black peppercorns and ½ a dried red chilli.
Add the chopped onions, minced ginger, bell peppers and the peach along with a big pinch of orange zest.
Add the jaggery and rice wine vinegar.
Reduce till the vinegar has reduced.
Cook for 10 minutes until the onions and peppers are soft but not mushy.
Add the juice of half an orange.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Add chopped mint and coriander leaves.

name: Yellow Squash Spaghetti
instructions: Peel and thinly shred the outer layer of the yellow squash and bottle gourd so that it resembles spaghetti.
Add a pinch of salt to it.
Chop the green chillies.
Heat the pan, and add oil, butter, sage, thyme, green chilies and grated ginger.
Squeeze out the moisture from the squash and add it to the pan.
Give it a good stir and add basil leaves.
Garnish with grated parmesan cheese.

name: Cauliflower Salad
ingredients: 10 gm red bell pepper finely chopped
instructions: For the cauliflower puree:
Slice one cauliflower, put it in a pan with milk, saffron and vanilla.
Boil till the flavours infuse.
For the cauliflower salad:
Grate a few cauliflower florets for it to look like cous cous.
To that add the chopped onion, capers, raisins, red bell peppers, coriander leaves, mint leaves, chopped plum and salt and pepper.
Add a little olive oil.
Add some tang with a cap of white wine vinegar.
Blend the cooked saffron and vanilla cauliflower into a nice puree with a small piece of butter and a dash of milk.
Spread the cauliflower puree on a plate with the salad and garnish with chopped plums and mint leaves.

name: East West Spring Rolls
instructions: In a hot pan add a dash of olive oil in which you can add the spring onions, green bell peppers and ginger.
Give it a good toss.
Add balsamic vinegar to deglaze and put in another bowl.
Blend the sun dried tomatoes with breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese and salt and pepper to taste.
Add some chopped chives and give it a nice mix, don't need to make it too smooth.
Mix with the spring onions and bell peppers.
In a small bowl make a paste with 2 tbsp corn flour and 1 tsp stock.
Brush a spring roll sheet with the corn flour paste.
Put a few basil leaves. Top them with the mozzarella and tomato mix.
Roll the spring roll into long cylindrical shape.
Using cornstarch and stock as a binding agent.
Deep fry till golden brown and serve with the basil dip.
For the basil dip:
In a mixer put basil leaves, olive oil, parmesan cheese, clove garlic, green chilly, green olives and mayonnaise and give a good blitz.
Add a pinch of salt and serve with the spring rolls.

name: Panko Crusted Cottage Cheese
ingredients: 1/2 cup breadcrumbs (here the chef uses Panko, Japanese bread crumbs)
instructions: Marinate the paneer with some salt, oregano, smoked paprika and cumin powder.
In a bowl make a batter with corn flour, white flour, milk and salt.
This will help the breadcrumbs cling to the paneer.
Dust some white flour over the paneer as well.
Coat with the batter and breadcrumbs.
Fry the paneer in a mixture of butter and olive oil.

name: Chickpea Soup
instructions: In a hot pan add the leeks, celery, onions, garlic, chives, rosemary, thyme and sage.
Add the chopped zucchini, squash, and bell peppers.
Add some red chilli flakes, white wine, chickpeas and the chickpea stock.
Stir and bring to a boil.
After the soup boils let it simmer for a few minutes and then blitz it.
While the soup is simmering you can sauté the leftover chickpeas, bell peppers, zucchini and yellow squash in olive oil as topping.
Garnish with grated cheddar cheese.

name: Corn and Raw Mango Salad
ingredients: 1 cup corn kernels or corn on the cob
1/2 Tbsp celery stalk peeled and diced
instructions: Blanch the corn in boiling salted water until tender but not overcooked.
Drain, set aside and chill.
Dice the onions, spring onions, red bell peppers, raw mango, pineapple, avocado and celery to almost the same size as the corn.
Cut the cherry tomatoes into half and add the parsley, cilantro and basil to the vegetables.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Add the lemon juice, olive oil and mix well.
Fill into taco shells for presentation or alternatively in a bowl.

name: 800 Corn Kernel Bisque
instructions: Melt the butter along with the olive oil in a pan.
Sweat the onions, leeks, celery, potatoes, yellow bell peppers, corn kernels along with the garlic for 5 to 7 minutes in a pan with olive oil.
Deglaze with white wine.
Add the vegetable stock and milk.
Simmer on a slow flame and cook till all the vegetables are soft.
With a slotted spoon take some of the vegetables out for the garnish.
Blend the soup.
Add cream, and season to taste.
Add the chopped herbs serve hot or cold along with the reserved diced vegetables

name: Garlic Soup
instructions: Dice the white onions, leeks, celery and potatoes.
Put the diced potatoes in a bowl of water and set aside.
In a heavy bottomed pot/pan, heat up some olive oil and butter.
Add all the diced vegetables, bay leaf and the sliced garlic and half of the roasted garlic to the pan.
Sweat for 5 to 6 minutes.
De-glaze with white wine, add the vegetable stock and cook till all the vegetables are soft and cooked through.
Add ½ a cup of milk and mix well.
Use a mixer or blender to blend the soup.
Season to taste with salt and pepper; add the chopped chives, tarragon and parsley.
For Garlic Chips:
Heat a pan with extra virgin olive oil and fry slices of garlic with some chilli flakes and a pinch of salt until brown and crispy.
Garnish the soup with chopped the herbs- chives, tarragon, parsley and the garlic chips.

name: Cottage Cheese and Green Spices
ingredients: For the Sun Dried Tomato and Apricot Tapenade:
1 tbsp oil from the sundried tomatoes
instructions: Cut the cottage cheese into thick slices using a cookie cutter to cut into small disk shapes.
In a mixer add the coriander, parsley, garlic, olive oil, green peppercorns, capers, green chilies and sage and mix to the green paste.
Marinate the paneer disks with the green paste.
In a pan heat some oil and pan fry the marinated paneer, until lightly brown.
For the Tapenade:
Remove the seeds and flesh of the pickled lemon.
Cut the pickled lemons in thin strips.
Put it in a mixer with sun dried tomatoes and its oil, olives, tomatoes thyme and basil.
Add chopped apricots and add some vegetable stock and blend into a nice paste.
Spoon he tapenade on to the plate with the paneer.

name: Soy and Potato Meat Balls
instructions: Bring the soy to boil in 200 ml of water for 3-4 minutes.
Drain the water, squeeze out excess and place in a large mixing bowl.
Bake the potatoes in the oven for 30 minutes until cooked.
In a pan heat a little olive oil and sauté the onions, garlic, capers, baked potatoes, red chilli flakes, smoked paprika, oregano, parsley and parmesan cheese.
Season this to taste with salt and cracked black pepper.
Soak the bread in a little milk for a few minutes.
Squeeze out the excess milk and add to the mix.
Shape the mixture into meat balls and pan fry.
For the sauce:
Put all the ingredients in a mixer and blend.
Heat up some oil in a pan and pour in the tomato juice.
Prepare the sauce, add meat balls and simmer.
Garnish with grated parmesan and parsley.

name: Charred Corn, Broccoli and Plum Salad
instructions: In a tray put the corn and broccoli and mix with some salt, olive oil and char grill.
Baste the broccoli and corn with dressing of sumac, zaatar and olive oil.
Remove the grilled corn and broccoli and put in a bowl along with the plums.
Crumble the feta cheese into the salad.
For the dressing:
For the Tagine spice mix:
In a mixer add ginger powder, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, roasted cinnamon, cumin and coriander seeds.
Grind into a powder.
Blend this spice mix along with the orange juice, extra virgin olive oil and brown sugar.
Give it a nice whisk.
Pour dressing on the salad.
Add a few mint leaves to garnish and serve.

name: Carrot Salad with Walnut Vinaigrette
ingredients: 1 big pinch cumin, freshly roasted and crushed
instructions: Blanch the carrots for 30-35 seconds in boiling salted water.
Drain and set aside.
Top and tail the tindli, cut into thin slices.
Add sliced tindli to the sliced carrots.
Mix in the pomegranate seeds with some olives and tarragon.
For the walnut citrus vinaigrette:
In another bowl grate some orange zest.
Whisk in walnut oil, orange juice, lime juice, salt and pepper and some mustard.
Put the salad on a plate and decorate with sliced star fruit.
Pour in the yummy dressing.
Serve.

name: Braised Red Cabbage with Bell Peppers and Green Apples
ingredients: 1/2 each red and yellow bell peppers
instructions: Marinate the chopped red and yellow bell peppers, cabbage, green and red apples, onions with the brown sugar and red wine vinegar.
Throw in some peppercorns and cinnamon stick for flavour.
Keep the marinated cabbage overnight in the fridge so that it absorbs the marinade.
Slowly cook the marinated red cabbage until soft.

name: Stuffed Mushroom Caps with Cheese
ingredients: Vegetable stock or water to deglaze
Few garlic chives & garlic chips for garnish
instructions: Marinate the mushrooms with olive oil, balsamic vinegar, thyme, sage and salt.
While the mushrooms are marinating, sweat the diced onion, bell pepper and garlic.
Deglaze the pan with water/stock or white wine and season to taste.
Add the diced dates.
Cool the mixture.
Add the mozzarella and gorgonzola to complete the filling for the mushroom stuffing.
Fill the mushroom caps with the mixture.
Top with the remaining cheeses.
Bake the mushrooms for 9 minutes at 180°C until cheese has melted.
Garnish with chives and garlic chips.

name: Vegetable Salad with Red Bell Pepper Jelly
ingredients: 1 whole red bell pepper roasted and peeled
instructions: For the Jelly:
In a mixer blitz together roasted bell peppers, agar agar and tomato juice.
After blitzing, heat up this mixture in a pan to a quick simmer and take it off the fire.
Strain the mix into a bowl to get rid of the skin and seeds.
Put the smooth liquid into moulds of any shape and size and refrigerate until firm and set.
For the Salad:
Put the salad leaves in a bowl and add salt & olive oil.
In a hot pan, heat up some brown sugar, sherry vinegar, salt and red jalapenos.
Put in a blender and blitz. This is the dressing for your salad.
Mix the dressing with the lettuce, diced pumpkin and papaya . Toss well to mix.
Mould this salad in a ring and place the red pepper jelly cubes on top of it.

name: Pomegranate and Mulberry Salad with Mango Caviar
instructions: For the Pomegranate and Mulberry Salad:Put all the ingredients in a bowl and season with parsley, onion powder, sushi vinegar and rock salt.
Give it a nice mix and serve.
Garnish with mulberries and chopped parsley.
For the Mango Caviar:
In a glass bowl blend 0.8 gms of sodium alginate with the mango juice and set aside.
Make a solution of calcium chloride and water.
In another glass bowl, keep some chilled water.
Using an injection drop the mango and sodium alginate mixture in the calcium chloride mixture.
This is a careful steady process.
Once you drop, this will form pearls or very small balls.
Using a slotted spoon or strainer, spoon out the small pearls and drop them into a bowl of chilled water.
This is like a rinse.
Strain and drain the excess water.
Spoon on top of salad.

name: Melon Balls with Rocket and Radish
instructions: In a bowl, add lime juice, honey, olive oil, ginger and salt.
Add chopped chives and give it a little mix.
Rest in the fridge for 10-15 minutes.
Cut the melons into half and remove the seeds.
Scoop out the fruit into small balls.
Use a peeler to peel out ribbons of radish.
Add the radish in a bowl with the melon balls, dressing, chopped fennel bulb, rocket and mint leaves.
Serve cold.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.

Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken

Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Sweet Potato Fries with Amla Aioli
ingredients: 1 big pinch Mexican chilli powder/ or any chilli powder
instructions: Wash the sweet potato to get rid of any soil.
Slice fairly thin into a bowl of chilled water.
In a stainless steel or glass bowl, whisk all the ingredients for the batter.
Set aside some of the rice and corn flour mixed with salt, pepper, Mexican chilli powder and oregano to dredge the sweet potatoes.
Drain the sweet potato and pat dry.
Dredge them with the flour mix, dip in the batter and deep fry in hot oil.
Blend all the ingredients for the dip together in a bowl.
Chill and serve with the chips.

name: Pumpkin and Spinach Pie
instructions: Pre heat the oven at 180 C for 9-10 minutes.
In a stainless steel bowl, sift the flour 2 - 3 times.
Add cubes of cold butter to the flour and rub in till the mixture resembles bread crumbs.
Add the parmesan cheese, cracked black pepper, pinch of salt and rosemary.
Mix in the cold water and form semi-stiff dough.
Wrap in cling film and rest for 30- 40 minutes in the refrigerator.
In the meanwhile, start with the filling.
Season the pumpkin with salt and pepper.
Put a teaspoon of olive oil and roast in the oven till soft for about 20 to 30 minutes.
On the same tray season the red bell pepper and roast for 15 minutes.
Once done, peel and dice the peppers and the pumpkin.
Sweat the onions, leeks, celery, garlic, green chilies in a little olive oil.
Add the bell peppers and the pumpkin, spices, herbs and cottage cheese and saute for 2 to 3 minutes.
Season the mixture with salt and pepper.
Once mixed, add in the cheddar cheese.
This is the filling for the pie.
Cool the filling and bring it to room temperature.
On a floured surface, divide the dough into two parts.
Roll the dough to a 2 cm thickness and place in the pie dish.
Bake the pie dough for 10 minutes @ 170°c.
Cool the baked base and then add the filling evenly.
Roll the rest of the dough to a 3 cm thickness and cover the pie.
Trim the excess of the dough and bake the pie for 20 minutes @ 165°c until the cover and base are properly cooked and is a golden brown colour.
Rest the pie for 20 minutes and cut into wedges.
Serve with some salad.

name: Sleek Leek and Raw Mango Fritters
instructions: In a bowl, sieve the chick pea flour.
Cut and add the tomatoes and green mango.
Sweat the leeks in olive oil and butter in a hot pan.
Add this to the batter mix.
Add a pinch of zaatar spice, salt and pepper.
Add the milk little by little to the besan based upon the consistency of your batter while continuously whisking.
The batter should be nice and thick.
Add some oil to a frying pan.
Ladle the batter on the frying pan to form fritters.
To serve stack like a pile or as you wish.

name: Yam Roesti with Tomato and Zucchini Relish
instructions: Half bake the sweet potato and yam for 15-20 minutes at 180°C.
Using a box grater, grate the sweet potato and the yam into thick shreds.
Mix in the minced onion, celery, leeks, chives, thyme, rosemary & olive oil.
Take about 50 grams of the mix and shape the roesti (patty/tikki).
Pan-fry in clarified butter in a non stick pan.
Serve with tomato and zucchini relish.
For the Zucchini Relish:
Sweat off the vegetables in olive oil.
Deglaze with white wine.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Add the basil and sage.

name: Mushroom Vol-Au-Vents
ingredients: A dozen vol au vent shells
instructions: Heat up vol au vent shells in the oven for a few minutes.
Put wild mushrooms in water to hydrate, slice mushrooms.
Put butter in a pan with olive oil till it melts.
Add onions, leeks and celery, rosemary, basil, thyme and oregano and a clove of grated garlic.
Add the button mushrooms.
Add a pinch of salt and pepper.
Add the white wine and reduce all the way till all the liquid is evaporated.
Add the cream to the mix reduce to a thick consistency.
Once ready fill it in the vol au vent case and garnish with chive leaves.

name: Roasted Bell Pepper and Broccoli Salad
ingredients: 2 Tbsp olive oil    Few sprigs of thyme
1 roasted yellow peppers    1 roasted red peppers
1 big head broccoli florets   1 broccoli stems    2 cloves sliced garlic chips
instructions: Season all the veggies with salt, pepper, thyme and olive oil.
Peel the bell peppers, cut into strips and deseed them.
Slice the broccoli stems.
Slice the garlic into chips, fry in olive oil and allow to cool.
Saute the onions in the garlic oil.
Cut the spring onions into batons.
Blend all the ingredients for the dressing in a mixer or hand blender.
Toss all the veggies along with the dressing.
Chill before serving.

name: Cluster Beans with Ginger and Citrus
ingredients: 30 gms spring onions, white part only
1 tsp ginger peeled and julienne    4 to 5 black olives pitted and chopped
1/2 each yellow bell pepper- julienne   1 green chilli julienne
instructions: In a very hot pan, stir fry all the ingredients except the nuts.
Season to taste.
Garnish with toasted chopped nuts and orange segments.

name: Hot Romesco
instructions: Roast red bell peppers on a grill (toss the red bell peppers in olive oil and salt) grill until charred  put in a bowl and cover with cling film.
Let them wrinkle, then peel, deseed and slice.
Season with some salt and pepper.
In a blender, add all the ingredients and blend while pouring the olive oil in a steady stream to emulsify to a thick rich sauce.

name: Chickpea and Almond Croquettes
instructions: Drain the chick peas and add all the other ingredients to make a slightly stiff dough.
Shape into cigar shape and rest in the fridge for 20 minutes.
Whisk up the milk in the flour and corn flour.
Season with salt and pepper.
Dip the cigars in this and the roll in the toasted almonds.
Deep fry till golden brown and serve with hot romesco sauce.

name: Hing Roasted Pumpkin
ingredients: For the Yoghurt Dressing:    2 Tbsp hung curd
A  big pinch of roasted cumin seed powder
A big pinch of black salt
instructions: Cut the pumpkin in  quarters, don't bother peeling it, its easier to peel after it is cooked.
Blend all the ingredients to a smoothie.
In a baking tray, place the wedges of pumpkin and pour the marinade all over and massage the pumpkin.
Bake for 30 min @ 180 °c
Rest the pumpkin until it is cool enough to handle for peeling and slicing.
Peel and slice the pumpkin, arrange on a plate/tray.
Pour  the dressing/sauce over the pumpkin.
For the Roasted Garlic:
Season a whole garlic with a pinch of salt and  olive oil.
Wrap in foil and bake for 30 minutes.
Pick out the cloves and puree and mix in with the yoghurt and spices.

name: Pink and Black Cottage Cheese Tournedos
ingredients: 225 grams - cottage cheese cut into thick discs
instructions: Make a chunky paste with the basil, garlic, chives, cashewnuts,lemon juice lemon zest, blanched spinach leaves, kasundi.
Season to taste.
Marinate the cottage cheese with this paste.
Pan sear quickly in a hot pan with a little butter and olive oil.
Roast and toast the pink peppercorns and peepli pepper.
Crush or grind coarsely.
Pat the cottage cheese with the crushed peppers. finish cooking in the oven.
For the Sauce:
Sweat the leeks, carrots and ginger in butter.
Add the white wine, orange juice and vegetable stock untill the carrots and leeks are softseason to taste.
Blend and strain through a fine strainer.
Add a dash of cream and chopped tarragon.
Spoon over the cottage cheese.

name: Glazed Ham
instructions: Drain ham.
Place apples in the pan with butter and rind.
Cover and cook until apples soften.
Stir in raisins herbs, sugar and seasoning.
Stuff into ham.
Place the stuffed ham in a large pan.
Add cooking ingredients.
Simmer for 1 1/2 hours until meat is tender.
Leave to cool.
Drain and stud with cloves.
For the glaze:
Warm syrup and pour over ham.
Combine jaggery and mustard with vinegar to moisten.
Spread over ham.
Bake at 180 degrees C for 20 minutes until golden in color.

name: Roast Turkey with Cranberry Sauce
instructions: Clean the inside of the turkey, keeping the skin intact.
In a mixing bowl, add chicken mince, pork fat, dry fruits, carrots, eggs, cream, brandy, rosemary and parsley.
Stuff the mixture into the turkey breast and tie up to seal the mixture.
Put into a baking tray with diced carrots, onions, celery, garlic and oil.
Cook the turkey for about 1 hour at 300 degree C until the turkey is tender and golden brown in color.
Serve with hot cranberry sauce, horseradish, buttered vegetables and glazed sweet potatoes.

name: Roast Beef
instructions: Combine the oil, onion, garlic salt, basil, marjoram, thyme, and pepper and mix well.
Coat the roast well with marinade. Marinate in refrigerator overnight.
Preheat an oven to 175 degrees C.
Line a roasting pan with an aluminum foil.
Combine the salt and water to form a thick paste.
Pat a cup of paste to a 1/2-inch thick rectangle in pan.
Pat the roast dry with paper towels and insert a meat thermometer.
Place the roast on the salt layer and pack the remaining salt paste around the meat to seal well.
Bake for an hour or until thermometer registers 140 degrees.
Remove it from the oven and let it stand for 10 minutes.
Remove and discard salt crust. Serve with an accompaniment.

name: Chicken Mousse
ingredients: 1 large chicken - cooked, skinned and minced
instructions: Melt butter. Toss in curry leaves and garlic and stir in curry powder. Cook for one minute.
For the Chicken Sauce:Add flour, followed by stock and milk. Thicken over a moderate flame. Then cool.
Gradually add the sauce to minced chicken.
Beat in butter and hung curd. Season well.
Fold in cream. Spoon into a lightly oiled mould.   Chill overnight.
Garnish the chicken mousse with tomatoes and herbs.
Serve the Chicken Mousse with toast.

name: Honey and Whole Grain Mustard Chicken
ingredients: 1 chicken, skinned and cut into 8 pieces
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 Tbsp whole / split yellow mustard seeds
instructions: For the homemade mustard:
Place the mustard seeds into a bowl. Cover with vinegar.
Set the bowl outside in the sunshine for 2-3 days or until the seeds have swollen in size.
Drain off the excess vinegar. Grind to a coarse paste or blend in segments.
Mix with the prepared mustard paste.
Spoon into an airtight bottle and allow it to mature for at least 3 days before tasting.
For the chicken:
Mix all the ingredients for the marinade.    Coat the chicken and marinate overnight in the fridge.
Place the chicken on a tray & spoon over 1-2 tbsp of the marinade.
Cook in a pre-heated oven at 200 degrees centigrade for 20 minutes.
When tender, remove from the oven and transfer to a serving dish.
Garnish with chopped fresh herbs.
Arrange on a bed of spinach leaves, tomatoes & almonds.
Flambe with 2 tbsp of whiskey

name: Honey and Fennel Roast Chicken
instructions: Mix the honey, fennel, garlic and seasoning together.
Spread the marinade under the skin of the chicken.
Roast in a hot oven, with the bay leaf, celery, onion, leek and carrot until golden brown in color.
Glaze with more honey and fennel before serving.
For the potatoes:
Mix the grated potatoes with the spices and garlic.
Shape into patties and fry in hot butter and oil until colored.
Serve with the roast chicken.

name: Grape Chicken
instructions: Blend grapes in a food processor and strain.
Place skin and seeds in a baking dish under chicken. Reserve juice.
Season chicken well and coat with melted butter.
Bake at 190 degree C for 10-15 minutes or until chicken is tender.
Remove chicken from tray.
Pour juice from tray into a saucepan with chicken stock and remaining grape juice.
Cook over high heat till the sauce reduces.
Strain and pour over chicken.
Garnish and serve.

ingredients: Herbs like oregano, parsley, thyme, rosemary
1 crusty French bread, you can use regular white bread too
instructions: Saute the chicken in 1 knob of butter for 1 minute.
Pour in juice. Simmer with chicken for about seven minutes until tender.
Stir in herbs and finally whisk in the rest of the butter.
Season well and garnish with orange/sweet lime segments just before serving.
For the garlic bread:
Slice the bread on the diagonal, not quite through to the base at 1 inch intervals.
Combine butter, garlic and pepper.  Spread over each slice.
Wrap in a foil and bake for 10 minutes in a very hot oven.
Unwrap and continue baking to crisp surface before removing from oven. Serve hot.

name: Barbecued Chicken
instructions: Wash and dry the chicken and prick all over with a fork.
Mix all the ingredients into the chicken, rubbing the mixture all over.
Keep the chicken marinated for 4 hours at least, turning a few times so the marinating is uniform.
Your chicken is now ready to barbecue. While barbecuing, keep brushing the chicken with the left over marinade.

name: Crumbed Chicken
instructions: Slice chicken and spread with mustard.
Stuff with ham, pineapple and cheese. Season.
Fold over top piece of chicken.
Coat each piece with flour, followed by egg and crumbs.
Saute in hot oil for about 7-10 minutes.
Serve with diced tomato accompaniment
For tomato accompaniment:
Combine tomatoes, onion, garlic and olives.
Toss in hot oil for 2 minutes.
Add lemon juice, herbs and seasoning.   Serve with chicken.

name: Spicy Baked Chicken
instructions: Combine all chicken spices with vinegar and rub over chicken.
For stuffing, lightly fry onion in oil for 1 minute, add garlic and after one 1/2 minute remove from heat and add remaining ingredients.   Fill into chicken cavity.
Bake at 220 degree C for about 40 minutes, until tender. Serve hot.

name: Chicken A La King
instructions: Mix the butter into the maida and keep aside.
Heat the milk and cream, bring to a boil and add the maida mixture.
Add the chicken, salt and kali mirch.
Simmer for a minute or so.
Add the wine and serve hot accompanied with boiled rice, if you so desire.

name: Chicken Sizzlers
instructions: Wipe the chicken breasts and beat with a mallet or a knife to flatten. Cut each into two pieces.
Mix the chicken with the other ingredients, except oil. Put aside to marinate for 2 hours or so.
Heat a frying pan with a thin layer of oil and add the chicken to it, over high heat.
Turn the chicken and then lower the heat and cook till tender, turning once so that it is brown on both sides.
Before placing the chicken on the sizzler plate, heat the iron plate very hot.
Place whatever accompaniments you are serving with it and immediately before serving on the table, splash some water and oil on it, and you will get the sizzling and fumes.

name: Corn Chicken
instructions: Saute bacon and chicken in oil until golden.
Add corn, garlic and vinegar.
Cover and cook for 15 minutes on a low heat.
Transfer chicken to an ovenproof dish.
Stir yoghurt and cream  into chicken gravy.
Season and add nutmeg. Pour over chicken.
Cover with spinach and tomatoes.
Bake at 180 degree centigrade for 15 minutes.
Serve garnished with mushrooms.

name: Herb Stuffed Chicken
instructions: Place chicken skin-side down on a board.
Sprinkle on 2 tbsp lime juice, garlic, spring onion and seasoning.
Heat butter in a pan, add chicken to pan with rind and juice of 2 limes.  Season.
Saute until cooked.
Strain juices from pan. Add stock, return to the flame and thicken with corn flour.
Season and add herbs.
Sprinkle remaining ingredients over chicken and grill until crisp.
Serve hot with the gravy.

name: Honey Roast Chicken
ingredients: 2 large onions - sliced and fried in oil until crisp
instructions: Make gashes over chicken.
Mix lemon juice, garlic and chilly powder.
Grind fried onions and mix well with the other ingredients for marinating.
Rub 2/3 of the resulting paste over and inside the chicken.       Set aside for an hour.
Mix the remaining marinade with the ingredients for the stuffing.
Fill chicken with the stuffing.
Place in a roasting tin.
Roast at 220 degree C, basting with the juices.
Cook for around 25 minutes or until tender.
Coat with honey and return to the oven for another 10 minutes.
Brush with oil before serving.

name: Chicken Delight
instructions: Saute chicken in butter and oil until golden in color.
Remove chicken from the pan.
Heat a little oil and saute chopped onions.
Add mushrooms and cook until tender.
Pour the gin and beer into the pan.
Add the chicken and seasoning and simmer until tender.
Transfer the chicken to a serving dish and reduce the sauce.
Add cream and remaining butter.
Pour the sauce on top of the chicken.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with pasta.

name: Roast Chicken with Apricot & Mint Stuffing
ingredients: 200 gm dried apricots soaked in diluted tea overnight
instructions: For making the stuffing:
Melt butter in a saucepan.
Add onion paste & cook for 3 minutes.
Drain apricots. Remove stones & chop coarsely.   Add to the pan and continue cooking for 3 minutes more.
Turn off the heat; add the lemon rind & breadcrumbs.   Season well and cool.
Add the mint & enough egg to bind mixture into a soft paste.
Final preparation:
Fill cavity of the chicken with paste before roasting.
Stuff the chicken with apricot filling.
Tie the joints close to the body.
Set the bird in a tray and pour over the well-flavored stock.
Spread the breast of the bird with 1 tbsp softened butter.
Roast in a pre-heated oven for 1 hour or until well colored and the flesh is tender when pierced in the thigh.
Set aside for 15 minutes before removing strings and carving.

name: Stuffed Dates Wrapped in Bacon
ingredients: 1 tsp chives12 bacon rashers 12 leek ribbons
instructions: Cut the dates lengthwise, but not all the way through . Take the seed out.
Whisk the cream cheese, mix in black pepper and chives, spoon into the dates.
Put it back to together. Wrap in bacon rashers. Bake in a hot oven fo 7 minutes.
Blanch the leeks in boiling salted water. Soak in iced water. Pat dry.
Roll the dates with the leek ribbons. Hold together with tooth picks.
Pan fry in olive oil (veg) / roll dates in bacon for non veg.

name: Leafy Salad with Walnuts
ingredients: 3  leafy vegetables  (lettuce, chinese cabbage)50 gm walnuts (grounded)1 Tbsp walnut oil
1 Tbsp sherry vinegar 4-5 cherry tomatoes A pinch of salt
instructions: Mix the leafy vegetables and the cherry tomatoes with the ground walnuts in a glass bowl.
Add the walnut oil and the sherry vinegar to the salad and mix well.
Serve with the parma ham.

name: Chicken Piccata With Bread Salad
ingredients: For the Chicken:2 chicken breast (batted thinly) 1/3 cup flour 1 egg 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese 1 tsp parsley1 tsp chives 1 Tbsp butter 1 tsp olive oilSalt & pepper to taste
1 small loaf ciabata bread 2 tomatoes 8 olives1/2 each bell peppers yellow 3 basil leaves1/2 cup olive oil 2 tsp red wine vinegar 1/2 cup tomato juice 1/3 cup sun dried tomatoes
instructions: For the Chicken: Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Make a batter with the Parmesan cheese, parsley, egg, chives.
Beat well. Dip the seasoned chicken into the flour and then into the batter.
Shallow fry in a mix of olive oil and butter until golden brown.
For the Salad:
Cut the bread into chunks. Sprinkle some olive oil, and bake for 6 minutes.
Set aside to cool slightly.
In a bowl mix the tomatoes, olives, yellow bell peppers and the sun dried tomatoes. Season to taste with salt and cracked black pepper.
Whisk together the tomato juice, red wine vinegar, olive oil, and the basil. Pour over the bread. Add it to the tomato and olive mixture.

name: Baked Prawns
ingredients: 4 prawns15 baby shallots 2 Tbsp olive oil 5 mushrooms (chopped) A small bunch of coriander1 cup cream 2-3 cloves garlic (shredded) 100 ml white wine 20 ml brandy 50 gm butter 20 gm parmesan cheese 20 gm gruyere cheese
instructions: In a pan heat some olive oil. Melt the butter and fry the baby shallots.  Grate in some cheese and stir till light brown. Add chopped mushrooms and stir.  Add the prawns and mix with the wine and brandy. Saute it   and add the cream. Transfer to a baking dish.  Grate some parmesan and gruyere cheese and set to bake at 180 degrees for 10 minutes.   Take out and garnish with coriander and serve.

name: Yogurt Dip with Crudites
ingredients: For the dip:250 gm hung yogurt1 stalk spring onions, finely chopped1 medium cucumbers, peeled1 tsp dill, chopped1 tsp parsley, chopped1/4 tsp roasted cumin powder 10 ml olive oil 5 ml lemon juice Salt to tastePepper to taste
For the crudites:  1 carrot 1 radish 1 cucumbers 1/2 each red bell peppers1/2 each yellow bell peppers 1/2 each green bell peppers 6 asparagus srears 4 baby corn
instructions: For the dip:  Put the chopped herbs in a large bowl, add the hung curd, lemon juice, olive oil and season to taste. Mix well and chill.  Prep up all the veg. Serve along with the dip.
For the crudites:  Peel and prep the vegetables. Soak in a bowl of chilled water to refresh.

name: Whole Roasted Fish
instructions: Clean, gut and scale the fish. Wash and pat dry.   In a food processor, blend all the ingredients to a paste. Rub all over the fish inside and out.  Lay the fish onto  a baking tray  and bake for 45 minutes in a moderate oven.
Once the fish is baked drizzle some oil or lemon juice on it.
Serve with a ratatouille.

name: Grilled Squid
ingredients: 4 large carrots (peeled and cut into angle into oval) 2 red onions (peeled and cut into rings)16 green olives12 coriander seeds (coarsely crushed) 1 small lemon (cut into 5 mm - 1/4 inch dice, seeds removed) 25 ml sesame oil 35 ml sunflower oil 2 Tbsp fish sauce 25 gm coriander seeds For the squid:   4 squids (cleaned) 2-3 Tbsp sesame oil (optional)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200 Degrees. Mix all the salad ingredients except the coriander leaves together and place in a     roasting dish. Cover with foil and roast for 20 mins.  Remove the foil, stir well, cover the dish again and roast for a further 15 mins.  Remove the foil and continue cooking until the carrots start to caramelise.  Remove from the oven and leave to cool, and then stir in the coriander leaves. For the Squids:   To cook the squid, either grill or fry in a wok with the sesame oil, for 1-2 mins.
To   assemble, spoon the salad and any juices on to a  plate and top with the grilled squid.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature

1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Smoked Kidney Bean Salad
ingredients: 75 gm cooked kidney beans1 stalk spring onions1 each yellow and red bell peppers1/2 cup cottage cheese3-4 lychees1 Green chilly1 radish 2 tsp lemon juice 1/2 cup olive oil 10 gm pickled gingerSalt & pepper to tasteA small bunch coriander leaves1 tsp cumin seed1/2 an orange, juiceA pinch of orange zest
instructions: Slice the spring onions on the bias thinly, julienne the bell peppers, pickled ginger and  radish.   Dice and saute the cottage cheese.   Dice the lychees, green chillies.   In a bowl mix all the ingredients  except the salt, pepper , olive oil and lemon juice.   Mix the olive oil and lemon juice. Pour into the bowl.   Season to taste. Garnish with fresh coriander.

name: Sausage Pepper Burger
ingredients: 1 tsp olive oil, to dab on the buns
Optional: Lettuce leaves, tomato slices, cheese slices, jalapeno, gherkins.
instructions: In a pan add olive oil, onions and saute for 2 minutes.   Add the bell peppers, green chillies, ginger and saute for a minute.   Mix in the sausages and cook for 5 - 7 minutes. Add the chilli sauce, soya sauce, honey and season with salt and rosemary.
Cut the burger bun in half, drizzle some oil and sprinkle some pepper. Warm the buns in a pan.
Add the sausage mixture on the bun. Place a cheese slice (optional).
Serve.

name: Bean Soup with Bacon and Vegetables
ingredients: 1 cup white beans cooked (Lobia, soaked and half cooked)
1.25 liters stock (You can use the water used to boil the white beans)
instructions: In a heavy bottomed pan, sweat the onions, carrots, celery, bayleaf and bacon in a little olive oil.  Add the vegetables and saute for 5-6 minutes.   Add the tomato puree, diced tomatoes and top up with water or stock.   Bring it to a simmer and add the half cooked beans.  Simmer for 25 minutes till the veggies are tender.   Season to taste and finish with chopped parsley.

name: Broccoli Salad
instructions: Toss together bell peppers, broccoli, jalapeno, apricots and almonds.
Drizzle olive oil, balsamic vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper.
Mix well.
Serve.

name: Surmai Steak with Red Bell Pepper Sauce and Pea Risotto
ingredients: For the surmai steak:   180 gm surmai stea
For the red bell pepper sauce:  2 red bell peppers
For the green pea risotto:  125 gm arborio rice
instructions: For the surmai steak:   Wash and pat dry the fish steak.   Marinate the fish with the rest of the ingredients.   Cook in a non stick pan, grill, or over coals.  Garnish with parsley and serve hot.

For red bell pepper sauce:  Roast the bell peppers in the oven. cover with cling film  or place in bag to sweat.  Skin and de seed the peppers.  Heat some oil, sweat off the spring onions, garlic.  Wine. add the red  peppers, add the tomato juice and cook for five minutes.  Blend, strain and finish with butter and chopped chives.
For green pea risotto:  Melt some butter in a heavy bottomed pan, sweat off the onions and celery.   Add the rice and fry well until all the rice is coated with the butter and vegetables.

De glaze with white wine. Add the stock little at a time until all the stock has been absorbed by the rice and the risotto is al dente.  Spoon in the pea puree and finish with cream.  Garnish with green peas.

name: French Fries
ingredients: 250 gm potatoes- peeled and cut into 'fingers'
instructions: Pour around 4 cups of water, enough to cover the potatoes, sprinkle with salt and boil. Slice the potatoes to a width of your choice. You can either opt for fat french fries or thin ones. When the water comes to boil, plonk the potatoes and switch off the gas. Now, leave the potatoes for 5 to 6 minutes.
Drain the water and put the potatoes on a tissue or dry cloth. Let them dry or if you're in a hurry dab it with a tissue to dry off the water.

Heat the oil till you can see small bubbles on the side. Now add the potatoes, one by one. Make sure the potatoes have enough space and aren't stacked on top of each other.Lower the heat to medium and fry till almost cooked but not brown. Lift the potatoes out of the oil and let the rest of it drain.Just before serving fry over high heat, till a golden brown and serve.

name: Pineapple, Cheese and Ham Salad
ingredients: 1/2 cup diced ham or fried bacon bits
instructions: Drain the pineapple and cut to match the size of the cheese cubes.
Cut the bell peppers into halves, remove seeds and stalk, and the extra white veins.
Shred peppers into thin strips.
Mix together, ham or bacon bits, the pineapple, peppers, cheese and gherkins and leave to chill.
Just before serving mix in the vinegar, salt and paprika, and serve chilled.
Note: You can avoid adding ham or bacon bits if you so desire.

name: Duke Salad
instructions: For the dressing:
Take a bowl and add mushrooms, half of the parmesan cheese, olive oil and lemon juice. Mix well.
Add the rocket leaves.
Garnish with parmesan cheese and serve.

name: Eggless Pancakes
instructions: Mix flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, milk, oil, vanilla essence and enough water to form a smooth paste. The batter should be of a coating consistency. Add more water if required.
Take a frying pan of about 6'-7' diameter and heat oil in it.
When the oil gets hot, turn over the pan and drain the excess oil off it.
Increase the heat again, and pour batter in the pan.
Lower the heat and cover the pan for about 10 seconds. Uncover the pan.
When edges of the pancake start lifting on its own, the pancake is done.
Just loosen the edges and turn the pan upside down over a plate and serve.

name: Mint Sauce
instructions: Heat the vinegar and sugar in a saucepan over low heat, stirring all the time.
Heat till the sugar is dissolved, then bring it to a boil and add the mint leaves and immediately shut off the heat and add the salt.
Your mint sauce is ready. This sauce keeps well if you pack it in a sterilised, screw top bottle while it is still quite hot.

name: Fish with White Sauce
ingredients: 8 fillets of fish-marinate in lemon juice and salt for 20 minutes & rinse
oil - a thin layer in a frying pan
instructions: Wipe fish dry. Heat the oil and add the fish over high heat. Brown on both sides, then cook over low heat till cooked.     Keep aside.
To make the sauce, melt the butter and add the refined flour, keeping the heat low.  Saute till just a suggestion of brown.
Take the pan off the fire and add the milk very gradually, stirring vigorously all the time.
Put the pan over the fire again and let it come to a boil, stirring often to avoid scorching.
When it comes to a boil, lower the heat and simmer for 1-2 minutes, continuing to stir.
Add the salt and pepper. Place the fish on a serving dish and pour the white sauce over it.
Garnish with cheese if you like.

name: Fish Mayonnaise
instructions: Rub the fish fillets with the lemon juice and 1 tsp of the salt. Keep aside for five minutes and wash off.
Steam the fish or boil till tender but still holds its shape. Drain and leave to cool.
When cool, and drained off well (otherwise wipe it lightly), arrange the fish on to a serving dish.
Add the celery and 1 tsp salt to the mayonnaise.
Cover fish with the mayonnaise, garnish with the greens and chill till ready to eat.
Note: You can also flake the cooked fish to tiny pieces and mix the mayonnaise in it and arrange in a neat shape on a serving dish.

name: Apple Sauce
instructions: Put peeled and chopped apples in a heavy-bottomed saucepan, with the water.
Cover and cook over low heat till some of the juices are drawn, and the bottom becomes liquidy.
Remove lid and let any excess liquid dry up, taking care not to let the apples burn.
Mash them a bit to make them pulpy.
Apples can also be stewed in a pressure cooker.
Add the sugar and cinnamon and cook a little more.

name: Date and Walnut Pie
ingredients: 1 cup milk - mixed with 2 tsp cornflour
A 6-7 inch pie dish - for baking
instructions: Mix the pastry ingredients to a dough and line the pie dish.
Prick the shell with a fork and bake in a pre-heated oven at 160 C-325 F for 15-20 minutes.
Remove from oven and cool.
Mix milk mixture, butter, sugar, brown sugar and blend well.
Cook on a slow fire till well blended.
Stir in walnut and dates and place mixture in the baked pie shell.
Bake at 160 C-325 F for 45 minutes or till set.

name: Green Apple Salad
instructions: Mix the apples and mango together in a salad bowl.
Sprinkle some salt and pepper into the mixture.
Break the coriander leaves and add it follwed by the lemon juice.
Mix everthing together and chill it in the fridge. Serve cold.

name: Spring Salad
ingredients: 2 red capsicums 2 yellow capsicums 1 zucchini 10-12 basil leaves 100 gm rocket leaves 1/2 iceberg lettuce 1 small bunch of parsley 10 pitted green olives 10 pitted black olives For the Dressing: 4-5 Tbsp olive oil 1 tsp balsamic vinegar 3-4 tsp dried oregano 1/2 tsp garlic puree Sea-salt - to taste
instructions: Cut the capsicums lengthwise and remove the seeds and core them. Then dice them into squares and keep them aside in a salad bowl. Chop the zucchini into round chunks, slice them in half, cut lengthwise into thin slices and add to the capsicum. Add the rocket leaves, basil leaves and parsley. Then roughly tear the iceberg lettuce and add to the capsicum. Chop the green and black olives into small pieces and add them to the salad. Whisk all the ingredients together. In the end add sea-salt and toss the salad. Serve.

name: Baby Lobster in White Sauce
ingredients: 2-3 baby lobsters (with the shell) 3 Tbsp butter 1 Tbsp flour 1 cup milk 2 Tbsp cheese bread crumbs salt - to taste pepper - to taste
instructions: Wash the lobster thoroughly and boil for 5-7 minutes along with the shell. Cut one side of the shell lengthwise in half and remove the meat. Cut the meat into small pieces. Clean and wash the shell again and keep aside. For the white sauce, heat butter in a pan. Sprinkle the flour and stir on low heat for 1-2 minutes. Pour the milk in it and stir continously to avoid lumps. Mix in the cheese, add salt and pepper. Continue to stir till it turns into a smooth paste. Now add the lobster meat into the sauce and gently mix it. Fill the clean shells with this mixture. Sprinkle the bread crumbs on top and bake in a hot oven for about 5 minutes. Serve hot as a starter.

name: Roast Leg of Ham
ingredients: 4-5 kg smoked leg of ham 5-6 cinnamon sticks 5-6 bay leaves 4-5 black cardamoms Water Mustard - to taste Honey - to cover ham 15-20 cloves 2-3 tsp bread crumbs 3-4 pineapple slices Pineapple juice (optional)
instructions: Make sure you order the smoked leg of ham with bone and fatty skin 3-4 days before cooking. Soak the leg of ham in water, add cinnamons, bay leaves and black cardamoms. Cover and cook it on a slow fire for 4-5 hours. Once tender, remove from water and cut the skin off the meat. Coat it with the mustard, honey and bread crumbs. Pin all the cloves in the meat and top it with the pineapple slices. Roast the ham in a pre-heated oven for 15-20 minutes. For the gravy, use the water in which the ham was boiled. Boil it further to thicken and add some pineapple juice. Slice the ham, pour the gravy on top and serve hot.
